Authors: Yahya F., Gaol F.L., Polla G., Budiastuti D.
Title: Implementation of PERMITAM Model to Strengthen the Adoption of Human Cloud Systems for Millennial Generation Workforces on Insurance Business
Authors with affiliations: Yahya, F., Bogor, Indonesia; Gaol, F.L., Bogor, Indonesia; Polla, G., Bogor, Indonesia; Budiastuti, D., Bogor, Indonesia
Abstract: Insurance is a financial product that legally binds the insurance company to pay losses of the policyholder when unfortunate situation occurs. This insurance market is often characterized by incomplete information on both market sides, which could result moral hazard behavior. The intermediaries’ system attempts to cope this situation and provide efficient information gather from the consumers. At the end, it resulted the insurance portfolio need suitable with their current risk profile. Additionally this system provides the policy contract design and claim settlement flow. The workforces operate the system also require special skills and expert in many different areas, mainly as insurance math and contract law. This requires a scalable provisioning and “de-provisioning” of human workforces, which we argue that the implementation of Human Cloud service could leverage to better position. According to US Census Bureau (2009) Millennials generations are having the highest percentage 25.47% worldwide. Recent research conduct by APJII in 2012 shows that the Millennials Generation occupied 58.4% Internet users in Indonesia. This figure believes would be more significant in recent future years resulted potential workforces. Understanding their perceived values would be important in order to maximize their potential as future workforces. Extended version of TAM is use for this study which enriches by the Perceived Millennials generation values, which we argue could lead to better understanding to this generation cohort. This extended version of TAM is call as Perceived Millennials Technology Acceptance Model (PerMiTAM). © Springer Nature Singapore Pte Ltd. 2019.
Author Keywords: Extended TAM; Human cloud; Insurance; Insurance intermediaries systems; PERMITAM
Index Keywords: Commerce; Contracts; Risk management; Extended TAM; Financial products; Incomplete information; Insurance companies; Insurance intermediaries; PERMITAM; Potential workforce; Technology acceptance model; Insurance

Authors: Atmojo R.N.P., Tjhin V.U., Wandoko W., Budiastuti D., Polla G., Mahesa R., Astuti T.N.K.
Title: Rekening Bersama (RekBer) the Indonesian escrow service of money
Source title: International Journal of Multimedia and Ubiquitous Engineering
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, West-Jakarta, Indonesia; School of Business and Management, Bina Nusantara University, West-Jakarta, Indonesia; Department of Statistics, Bina Nusantara University, West-Jakarta, Indonesia; School of Business and Management, Prasetiya Mulya Business School, South-Jakarta, Indonesia; Department of Law, The Christian University of Indonesia, East-Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Atmojo, R.N.P., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, West-Jakarta, Indonesia; Tjhin, V.U., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, West-Jakarta, Indonesia; Wandoko, W., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, West-Jakarta, Indonesia; Budiastuti, D., School of Business and Management, Bina Nusantara University, West-Jakarta, Indonesia; Polla, G., Department of Statistics, Bina Nusantara University, West-Jakarta, Indonesia; Mahesa, R., School of Business and Management, Prasetiya Mulya Business School, South-Jakarta, Indonesia; Astuti, T.N.K., Department of Law, The Christian University of Indonesia, East-Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: That was a common thing when Escrow Service of Money (ESM) providers handled by the institution that has a legal aspect (structural assurance) to operates their business activities. However, how if the bank-like service agency operates by the individual, performed online and does not have some guaranteeing assets? How they do warrant their customers that they will not violate the consumer trusts? In addition, did the customers trust them? In this paper appointed a case study of the Rekening Bersama (RekBer) phenomenon as Indonesian ESM. Where, most of them ran the bank-like business without forming a legal entity as a reliable guarantee. In spite of that, we found a unique behavioral pattern that either incorporated RekBer or individual RekBer has the same opportunity to being trusted by their trustors. © 2016 SERSC.
Author Keywords: Consumer behavior; E-Business; E-Commerce; Escrow Service of Money; Logistic regression; Management information systems; Online trust; Rekening Bersama (RekBer)
Index Keywords: Electronic commerce; Information management; Management information systems; Online systems; eBusiness; Escrow services; Logistic regressions; Online trust; Rekening Bersama (RekBer); Consumer behavior

Title: Comparison of Approximation Accuracy and time Integral Process between Simpson Adaptive Method and Romberg Method
Abstract: Abstract: This paper is the result of research that discusses the accuracy of approximation and the comparison of processing time between Simpson Adaptive method and Romberg method in solving the integral numerically. The research was carried out through several experiments in order to solve integral process with computer through the five types of functions i.e. polynomial functions, exponential functions, trigonometric functions, the combined functions of exponential polynomials, and also the combined functions of trigonometric polynomials. As the point of approximation accuracy relative mistakes is used for the relative error value, and to bookmark the time complexity of the algorithm is used. The test results in the non-parametric statistics Jackknife at a=0.05 level of significance shows that the fifth integral function under study gives the following results: Romberg method has an average relative error, which is smaller than the Adaptive Simpson's method, so it can be concluded that the method of Romberg has a better approximation accuracy compared with the Adaptive Simpson's method in integral approximation. Adaptive Simpson's method has an average processing time, which is smaller than the Romberg method. Thus, it can be concluded that Adaptive Simpson's method requires a shorter processing time than the Romberg method in approximate integral. © 2015 TARU Publications.
Author Keywords: adaptive Simpson method; approximation; Method of Romberg; processing time integral
Index Keywords: Approximation algorithms; Computational complexity; Error statistics; Exponential functions; Functions; Polynomials; approximation; Exponential polynomials; Method of Romberg; Non-parametric statistics; Processing time; Simpson; Trigonometric functions; Trigonometric polynomial; Integral equations

Authors: Wang G., Polla G., Beng J.T., Kumaradjaja R.
Title: Knowledge management model: The role of absorptive capacity in improving the new product development (NPD) process
Authors with affiliations: Wang, G., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia; Polla, G., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia; Beng, J.T., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia; Kumaradjaja, R., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia
Abstract: The term absorptive capacity (AC) refers to acquiring the external resources to improve innovativeness and performance inside the firm. Since its introduction in year 1990, AC has gained wide popularity for its application in the business world; nevertheless, its application still rare to be found in the vocational schools (known as polytechnics) in Indonesia. In general, the Indonesian polytechnics have lack of AC mechanism in improving their collaboration model with the firms. The article examines the important role of knowledge management (KM) model to improve the AC mechanism inside the state-owned polytechnics. The state-owned polytechnics have mission to support local and national economic corridors, and strengthening the foundation of firms. The article proposes the development of KM model based on the AC studies in the firms, and links them with the efforts in creating new product advantage (NPA). © 2015 American Scientific Publishers. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Absorptive capacity (AC); Environmental turbulence; Ideation; Motivation; New product advantage (NPA); Potential AC; Prior customer knowledge; Project complexity and risk; Realized AC; Support system

Authors: Elidjen, Polla G., Alamsjah F., Beng J.T.
Title: An integrated model of knowledge management and organizational learning capability, organizational innovativeness, and sustainable competitive advantage
Affiliations: Information Technology, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia; Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia; Industrial Engineering, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia; Information Systems, Tarumanegara University11470, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Elidjen, Information Technology, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia; Polla, G., Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia; Alamsjah, F., Industrial Engineering, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia; Beng, J.T., Information Systems, Tarumanegara University11470, Indonesia
Abstract: Nowadays, business competition is increasingly competitive and unstable. Organizations are faced with a lot of product variants and better services from competitors and shorter product life cycles while the cost to produce the product or service is getting higher because of the additional cost required to innovate to anticipate the business competition. Organizations need to strengthen their organizational innovativeness through knowledge management capability and organizational learning capability to enhance sustainable competitive advantage. The methodology used was literature research and some personal experience and interpretations. The proposed model hopefully contributes to enrich its intellectual study of knowledge management, organizational learning, organizational innovativeness, and sustainable competitive advantage. © 2015 American Scientific Publishers. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: An integrated model; Knowledge management capability; Organizational innovativeness and sustainable competitive advantage; Organizational learning capability

Title: Comparing accuracy of differential equation results between Runge-Kutta Fehlberg methods and adams-moulton methods
Affiliations: Faculty of Sciences and Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Jakarta 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Polla, G., Faculty of Sciences and Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah, Jakarta 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: There are many issues in the fields of physics, chemistry, biology, and astronomy which can be solved through differential equation formulations. In general, the completion of differential equations can be done analytically or by numerical methods. If the completion is done analytically, usually it is done through calculus theories, and may require a longer time to solve. Anticipating the difficulties posed by differential equations analysis, numerical method is being used instead. This numerical completion provides solution in the form of approach and being carried out by visiting the initial value which then needs to be advanced gradually, step by step. Utilizing computers in solving differential equations would also help develop the application of numerical methods. Therefore, this study is expected to be able to improve the existing methods. This research will compare the accuracy of different methods, the Runge-Kutta Fehlberg and Adams-Moulton methods, in completing differential equations, which is limited to ordinary differential equations of first order and second order. It is found that there is general difference between the two method with Runge-Kutta Fehlberg method being the one-step method with an uncertain step size, while the Adams-Moulton method being the double steps method. Comparison of accuracy is obtained through comparing the value of differential equations results numerically with differential equations result obtained from MatLab version 5.3. A number of experiments on the completion of linear ordinary differential equations of first order and second order are done through computerization to compare the accuracy between the Runge-Kutta Fehlberg and Adams-Moulton methods. In addition, accuracy is being pointed out through relative error. From the research results with the non-parametric statistical test it can be seen that the Jackknife for linear ordinary differential equations of first order and second order, the Runge-Kutta Fehlberg method has an average relative error greater than the Adams-Moulton method. It can be concluded that the Adams-Moulton method has more rigorous accuracy than the Range-Kutta Fehlberg method in solving linear ordinary differential equations of first order and second order. © 2013 Gerardus Polla.
Author Keywords: Adams-Moulton Method; Differential equation; Runge-Kutta Fehlberg Method
References: Herwindiati, D.E., Metode Jackknine dan Metode Bootstrap: Perbedaan dan Aplikasi (1998) Jurnal Komputer dan Elektronika, 1 (1), p. 54; Atkinson, K.E., An Introduction to Numerical Analysis (1978), 2nd ed., Toronto: John Wiley & Sons, Inc; Chapra, S.C., Canale, R.P., Metode Numerik Untuk Teknik (1991), Jakarta: Universitas Indonesia; Chapra, S.C., Canale, R.P., Numerical Methods for Engineers (1989), 2nd ed., Singapore: McGraw-Hill, Co
